intro: Neolloydia conoidea, commonly known as the slender sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or purple in color. Neolloydia conoidea thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
